carousel_items: Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Full effects in 8 to 12 weeks for mood, 2 weeks for pain.
Stop taking slowly to avoid withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

basics.benefits_moa: Cymbalta is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Cymbalta is good for treating depression and anxiety, and may help with chronic pain. More likely than other antidepressants to cause problems if you drink or have high blood pressure.
downsides: Not a good option if you're a heavy drinker, or if you have liver or kidney problems.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Like most antidepressants, can cause higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a good option if you're a heavy drinker, or if you have liver or kidney problems.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Like most antidepressants, can cause higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

upsides: Effective at relieving depression and anxiety symptoms.
Can relieve some types of chronic pain. Might be particularly good at pain relief for people who are also depressed.
Six out of ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at relieving depression and anxiety symptoms.
Can relieve some types of chronic pain. Might be particularly good at pain relief for people who are also depressed.
Six out of ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

drugs.one_liner: Improves mood and relieves certain kinds of pain.

userStories.tip: Does it cause a lot of perspiration and weight gain--sertraline did
dry mouth and numbness in lower lip But, it relives my pain!

userStories.identifier: i fell out of a tree deer hunting
userStories.tip: I take it at night to help me sleep and it help with my mood plus help with my pain
Suicidal thoughts. However, I was very young. Now I take Zoloft and am very happy - even though the pain still kicks my bum.
it helped with my pain and depression but hurt my kidneys and i stayed short of breath
it made my chest hurt and was giving me chest pains, felt like little jolts in my chest. felt pain when I took a deep breath
Cymbalta did not work and made me suicidal!!! I had to be hospitalized!!!! The worst drug and experience of my life!!!
DON'T EVER START IT! NO MATTER WHAT YOUR DOCTOR SAYS! It's the worst drug when its stopped!

userStories.tip: Give us more info on side effects!
Ginger helps with the nausea.
Caused me extreme scratching where I had my worse nerve pain.
the excessive sweating
Reduced some anxiety and depression.  My memory suffered and it was very frustrating which ended up causing more anxiety and depression.

userStories.identifier: active senior, use toning tables exercis
userStories.tip: Excellent, I tried several others before, not addictive, may cause excess thirst
Take it regularly at the same time everyday
Cymbalta withdrawal is awful! Over 40% of people experience significant withdrawal symptoms and it is really bad! Think twice before starting because quitting is a bitch!
No doctor can tell me what this working is actually supposed to look like other than more pain.
It was my last resort...........I had tried everything else with bad side effects....this has saved my life.
Second antidepressant I tried. Helps a lot. Had to increase dose after about a year, but not since then. Best part was when it went generic two years ago.
First few days were a little rough, once you get through that feeling of you body and mind disconnected and then settle in to a balance, it's been great.
I have Fibromyalgia & Arthritis. Was on med for depression. Dr changed to Cymbalta to "help pain & depression". I've gained wt, pain is same & mental/emotional status not good. Going back to Zoloft.
do not take side effects r not worth it
I take it at night. Works for my depression however I still have anxiety.
Hard to get off of. Brain Zaps.
Withdrawal symptoms are terrible. It's taken me 1.5 years to wean off, and I was only on for 8 months.

userStories.identifier: Active senior with chronic back pain
userStories.tip: I had no idea the process of getting off this drug would be so horrible. I have had sexual side effects and had diarrhea for 6 weeks.
Coming off is hell. Being on fucks up everything.
it works pretty good for neurologic nerve pain.
I took a low dose and it still worked. Now I take 30MG every other day and still get anxiety relief and pain relief.

I have had been taking Cymbalta over the last 10 years off and on (mostly off). My experience has been that although it has been beneficial for my symptoms (anxiety & depression), the physical side effects are too much to handle long term.
Carry water with you.
I agree with some of the others on this review that taking it later helps me with sleep instead of taking in the morning a prescibed
I always carry a drink with me for dry mouth.
Helped with mood and anxiety. Increased patience. Good sleep. Unfortunately some acid reflux at night.
It has severe withdrawal side effects.
prevents orgasm

heavy nausea and vomiting. before I could stop it there was unrepairable damage to my jaw nerves and blood flow. at 43 I had perfect white beautiful teeth then went to grey and falling out with no bleeding or pain.

After taking cymbalta for nearly two years I suddenly developed a severe itchy skin rash, mostly on my back and legs. Skin biopsy of a section of the rash determined it was a medication allergy. Currently tapering off completely.
Been on it for several years and feel its time has come to an end. Have had many suicidal thoughts and crying spells lately. Also low energy aches and pains and just general blahs. Time to switch

userStories.identifier: Retired, but still attempt to make art.
userStories.tip: I began to have automatic spastic movement issues which were frightening.  However I was pain free for approx 3 weeks, which was wonderful.
I am severely depressed and barely functioning without it. My quality of life is definately better. Do not skip a dose. You will feel it immediately.
cymbalta totally incapacitated me and left me laying,drooling on the couch for most of the day.. DON"T use this drug..!!!
It made my pupils dilate very large for a while, and being a former drug user this caused loved ones to be suspicious.
how it worked.
no.
wish i knew core about it.
The cost remains prohibitive even though it's offered under a generic name now
It was effective for fighting my depression, but weaning off of it is a very slow process

At first it made me extremely tired in the evenings as it was wearing off. Fixed that by taking it later in the day. Also, it's expensive. Even the generic. Has done wonders for my depression.
Start small to ease potential side effects. You can open the capsule and take half, to start, and then ease up over a couple of days. Don't be discouraged!
I haven't had trouble with Cymbalta, but if I forget to take it for a few days I really feel it. Terrible nausea, clamminess, anxiety, etc. Set alarms as a reminder!
A little hassle cause medication should be taken with food like a meal.
You don't realise the effect of this drug until you try and come off it, brutal, worked ok.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

drugs.name: Cymbalta

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Full effects in 8 to 12 weeks for mood, 2 weeks for pain.
Stop taking slowly to avoid withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Cymbalta with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Cymbalta with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Cymbalta suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Cymbalta suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

carousel_items: If taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth, take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can cause stomach ulcers, especially if taking it by mouth often.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily. You shouldn't take any other 'blood thinner' medications unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Don't use it the first two weeks after a heart surgery.
Can affect your kidneys' ability to work as well.

If using the skin (topical) gel, use the dosing card it comes with to make sure you measure the correct dose. You also won't have many of the same side effects that you would if taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

basics.benefits_moa: Diclofenac sodium is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Diclofenac sodium works well for pain and causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs.
downsides: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
May treat arthritis pain better than other similar medicines (NSAIDs).
Can cause less upset stomach than other NSAIDs like ibuprofen (Advil).
It's also available as a gel that you put on your skin. If it's hard for you to swallow pills, this could be a good option.
If you're only using the gel, you won't have the same side effects that you would while taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
May treat arthritis pain better than other similar medicines (NSAIDs).
Can cause less upset stomach than other NSAIDs like ibuprofen (Advil).
It's also available as a gel that you put on your skin. If it's hard for you to swallow pills, this could be a good option.
If you're only using the gel, you won't have the same side effects that you would while taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

userStories.tip: Took Diclofenac SOD for CPPD (Inflammatory arthritis) for yrs before bilateral knee replacements. 3yrs later, I'm having swelling/pain after golf/long walks/workouts.  Meloxicam didn't help so asked for Diclofenac.  It still works for me!

userStories.identifier: Male with occasionally severe back pain
userStories.tip: My doctor prescribed Voltaren because he has completely undue fears of VicoProfen, but while VicoProfen works exceptionally well, Voltaren has no detectable effect on my pain.
If you feel dizzy, bring it up to your doctor.  Mine lowered the dosage and it helped a lot!

drugs.name: Voltaren

carousel_items_processed.orig: If taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth, take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can cause stomach ulcers, especially if taking it by mouth often.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily. You shouldn't take any other 'blood thinner' medications unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Don't use it the first two weeks after a heart surgery.
Can affect your kidneys' ability to work as well.

If using the skin (topical) gel, use the dosing card it comes with to make sure you measure the correct dose. You also won't have many of the same side effects that you would if taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. Don't take Diclofenac sodium while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. Don't take Diclofenac sodium while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Diclofenac sodium can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Diclofenac sodium and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Diclofenac sodium can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Diclofenac sodium and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Lowers kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Diclofenac sodium for long periods of time.
risk_factors: Taking ACE inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs)

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Diclofenac sodium for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Diclofenac sodium can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Diclofenac sodium can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Cymbalta has significantly eased my leg pain (from stenosis)

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: Pristiq was great except it only worked for a year. I have been taking cymbalta since it was brand new drug. It can work for years.
